title: Coasting along Big Sur
caption: Spotting whales from Big Sur
desc: In late winter and early spring here on the US Pacific coast, thousands of grey whales, many with calves in tow, swim past California's Big Sur as they migrate from the warm waters of Mexico to their summer feeding grounds in the Bering Sea.
copyright: Aerial view of the Big Sur coastline near Monterey, California, USA (Â© Blue Planet Archive/Alamy)
